vstore.framework.matching

Class Matching

  • java.lang.Object
    • vstore.framework.matching.Matching

  • public class Matching
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles the storage decision, e.g. matching a file to a storage node based on the usage context, the file meta data and the user intention, as well as the list of available storage nodes.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Matching.MatchingMode
      Different matching modes.

    • Field Detail

      • mDecidedNodes

        private java.util.List<NodeInfo> mDecidedNodes
        Will hold the information about all decided node(s) after the matching process. If a decision layer resulted in no storage node, this will also be put into this list

      • mValidNodes

        private java.util.List<NodeInfo> mValidNodes
        Will hold the information only about the valid nodes after the matching process (no null entries).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Matching

        public Matching(VStoreFile f,
                Matching.MatchingMode mode)
         throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Make a new storage decision for the given parameters. If no rule matches, a default matching is done. A default matching is also done, if a rule has a specific storage node configured but this one cannot be found in the Node Manager. To get the node that resulted from matching, use getDecidedNodes(). All parameters must not be null, or a RuntimeException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        f - The file to make the decision for. Must not be null and should contain a context description.
        mode - The matching mode, one of the enum type Matching.MatchingMode.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - in case some parameters are null

    • Method Detail

      • keepRuleInSet

        private boolean keepRuleInSet(VStoreRule r,
                              VStoreFile f)
        Parameters:
        r - The rule for which to check if it should be eliminated from the matching rule set
        f - The file for which the matching is currently being done
        Returns:
        True, if the rule should be deleted from the rule set used for matching. False, if the rule should be kept in the set of rules used for matching.

      • sortRulesByScore

        private java.util.List<VStoreRule> sortRulesByScore(java.util.List<VStoreRule> rules)
        Sorts the given list of rules based on the detail score.
        Parameters:
        rules - The list of rules to be sorted.
        Returns:
        A list which contains the given rules in order based on the detail score.

      • getNodesForRule

        private boolean getNodesForRule(VStoreRule rule,
                                VStoreFile file,
                                boolean keepNodesAlreadyFound)
        This method determines the node (or multiple storage nodes) for the given rule. Will go through all decision layers and - depending on the rule configuration - will either - continue until one layer yields a result or until the end is reached. - or find a node for each decision layer and store the file on all of them.
        Parameters:
        rule - The rule to find a node for.
        file - The file to find a node for.
        keepNodesAlreadyFound - If set, the nodes already contained in the decidedNodes list are kept. If set to false, the list is cleared before search.
        Returns:
        True, if a match was found. False, if not.

      • getNodeFallback

        private static NodeInfo getNodeFallback(VStoreFile f)
        (CURRENTLY NOT USED!!!!) This method determines the node for the given file without rules. This is just experimental and not finished. Currently not used.
        Parameters:
        f - The file to find a node for.
        Returns:
        The NodeInfo of the decided node. Or null, if no decision was possible.

      • getDecidedNodes

        public java.util.List<NodeInfo> getDecidedNodes()
        Returns the node(s) this decision has decided for.
        Returns:
        If decision was successful, it will return a list of NodeInfo objects. If decision was not successful, null will be returned.
